form.label: Usage vs. Size Limit(s)
form.searchTemplate: `fb_data_from_today` `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$)` | fields _time, index, path, state, sizeOnDiskMB | bucket _time span=1d | dedup _time, path

html.div:
The family of views in the Retention menu is aimed at helping administrators visualize and thereby tune various retention parameters for their indexed data. General information about retention settings can be found in the Splunk documentation for version 6.0.x here.
This particular dashboard shows both index usage, as well as retention polices based on size. This is a very common means of constraining the overall disk usage of a Splunk index by setting a limit on how much space it can use.
The leftmost panel (Home (Hot + Warm) Path) shows the combined usage in the "home path", which contains both hot and warm buckets. The space limitation set for this path group is optional, and is referenced as homePath.maxDataSizeMB in indexes.conf. The configured value, if any, is shown in the field labeled "Limit". Similar to the the Home Path, the Cold Path Usage reflects the usage for buckets in the cold state. The corresponding "Limit" is coldPath.maxDataSizeMB. In the third panel, titled Configured Total Space Limit, the setting for the combined disk usage of buckets in all states (except thawed) is shown. This corresponds to the maxTotalDataSizeMB parameter in indexes.conf. Finally, in the right-hand panel is displayed the Thawed Path Usage; this location is for index buckets which have been restored from the archive path. These are not subject to any retention policy, and must be managed manually.
The next row of panels are visual representations of various states of the data. If there are ballast buckets (buckets with future time stamps) within the home path, the amount of that path usage (as a percentage) appears in a filler gauge titled Ballast in Home Path (Hot + Warm). To the right is a similar representation of any ballast found in the cold path. The time chart showing Usage vs. Configured Maximum Size will display usage for the home path, cold path, and the limits for each. If ballast is present in either state, it will be shown as a time-trend as well.

input.label: Host
input.populatingSearch: | inputlookup fb_hostname_index_cache | dedup orig_host | sort orig_host

input.label: Index
input.populatingSearch: | inputlookup fb_hostname_index_cache | search orig_host=$host$ | dedup orig_index | sort orig_index

single.searchPostProcess: `_fb_where_today` AND (state="hot" OR state="warm") | stats count, sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS homeUsage | fillnull homeUsage value=0 | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(homeUsage)`
`_fb_where_today` AND state="cold" | stats count, sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS coldUsage | fillnull coldUsage value=0 | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(coldUsage)`

single.title: Thawed Path Usage
single.searchPostProcess: `_fb_where_today` AND state="thawed" | stats count, sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS thawedUsage | fillnull thawedUsage value=0 | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(thawedUsage)`

chart.title: Ballast in Home Path (Hot + Warm)
chart.searchString: state="hot" OR state="warm" `fb_data_from_today` `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$)` | fields _time, index, path, state, sizeOnDiskMB, endEpoch | bucket _time span=1d | dedup _time, path | eval title="$index$", state=if(endEpoch > now(), "ballast", "home") | search state="ballast" | join index [| `_fb_rest_index_config($host$, $index$)` | fields index homePath.maxDataSizeMB, maxTotalDataSizeMB ] | eval limit=if('homePath.maxDataSizeMB' = 0, maxTotalDataSizeMB, 'homePath.maxDataSizeMB') | stats count, first(limit) AS limit, sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS size | fillnull value=0 limit, size | eval percent=if(limit=0, 0, round(size / limit * 100, 2)) | gauge percent 0 20 40 60 80 100

chart.title: Ballast in Cold Path
chart.searchString: state="cold" `fb_data_from_today` `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$)` | fields _time, index, path, state, sizeOnDiskMB, endEpoch | bucket _time span=1d | dedup _time, path | eval title="$index$", state=if(endEpoch > now(), "ballast", "cold") | search state="ballast" | join index [| `_fb_rest_index_config($host$, $index$)` | fields index homePath.maxDataSizeMB, maxTotalDataSizeMB ] | eval limit=if('homePath.maxDataSizeMB' = 0, maxTotalDataSizeMB, 'homePath.maxDataSizeMB') | stats count, first(limit) AS limit, sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS size | fillnull value=0 limit, size | eval percent=if(limit=0, 0, round(size / limit * 100, 2)) | gauge percent 0 20 40 60 80 100

chart.title: Usage vs. Configured Maximum Size
chart.searchString: state!="thawed" `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$)` | fields _time, index, path, state, sizeOnDiskMB, endEpoch | bucket _time span=1d | dedup _time, path | eval state=if(state=="hot" OR state=="warm", "homePath", if(state=="cold", "coldPath", state)) | eval state=mvappend(state, if(endEpoch > now(), "ballast", null())) | join type=left index [ | `_fb_rest_index_config($host$, $index$)` ] | eval limit=if(state=="homePath", coalesce('homePath.maxDataSizeMB', maxTotalDataSizeMB), if(state=="coldPath", coalesce('coldPath.maxDataSizeMB', maxTotalDataSizeMB), 0)) | timechart span=1d sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS "Disk Usage", first(limit) AS Limit by state | fields - "Limit*ballast"

chart.title: Day-on-Day Index Growth (Last 30 Days)
chart.searchString: `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$)` | fields _time, index, path, state, sizeOnDiskMB | bucket _time span=1d | dedup _time, path | stats sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS Usage by _time | delta Usage AS Growth | eventstats avg(Growth) AS avg | timechart span=1d first(Growth) AS "Daily Growth", first(avg) AS "Average Daily Growth"
